name: St. Margaret of Cortona
summary: Margaret of Cortona was an Italian penitent who became a Franciscan tertiary. After living in sin and bearing an illegitimate child, she experienced a conversion and devoted herself to penance and works of charity. She founded a hospital for the poor and became known for her visions, ecstasies, and devotion to the Eucharist. She is known as the patron saint of the homeless, single mothers, and those who have lost children.
